description: Number of non-isomorphic arrangements of n lines in the real projective plane such that the lines do not all pass through a common point.
references: J. E. Goodman and J. O'Rourke, editors, Handbook of Discrete and Computational Geometry, CRC Press, 1997, p. 102.
B. Grünbaum, Arrangements and Spreads. American Mathematical Society, Providence, RI, 1972, p. 4.
links: N. J. A. Sloane, Illustration of a(3) - a(6) [based on Fig. 2.1 of Grünbaum, 1972]
crossrefs: See A132346 for the sequence when we include the arrangement where the lines do pass through a common point, which is 1 greater than this.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
